Hello: I just encountered somthing I doubt is normal ubuntu behavior... (probably not even ubuntu-related)
In the middle of playing Diablo II, my keyboard died and so I restarted the computer. Now after the grub boot, nothing happens, it doesn't boot anything. Does this sound familiar?
i would check your hard drive
if you can't boot your computer, it is likely to be a problem with the hard drive (although there are other candidates)
at the very least you should fsck it
it's also worth giving memtest a go
it should be one of the grub boot options
depends how much ram you have; you can just let it run overnight
If I don't get it running, I probably will :P
it is probably faster than doing a full badblocks scan of the hard drive though
well, fsck didn't find anything wrong with my partition :/
you need to do a full scan to really be sure; it probably just replayed the journal
a full scan generally takes at least an hour
